## Course content

The course curriculum contains theory and interactive exercises as outlined in the table below. 
This is the curriculum for all the OSTE courses and workshops.
The teaching material is openly available (see links below).

| Topic                          | Content                                                  | Link to material                                                            |
|-----------------|------------------------|-------------------------------|
| Introduction to OS             | General introduction to OS                               | is coming soon                                                                      |
| Tools and approaches           | Data management plan, data papers and registered reports | is coming soon                                                                      |
|                                | Executable documents with Quarto                         | [BioST\@TS tutorial](https://biostats-r.github.io/biostats/quarto/)         |
| Data collection and management | Data collection                                          | [BioST\@TS tutorial](https://biostats-r.github.io/biostats/datacollection/) |
|                                | Data handling                                            | [OS Repo](https://github.com/Open-Science-Course/OS-course-teaching-material)                                                                        |
|                                | Best practice in coding                                  | is coming soon                                                                        |
| Data repositories              | GBIF presentations                                       | is coming soon                                                                         |
|                                | Living Norway R package to publish data                  | is coming soon                                                                    |
| Reproducible workflows         | Version control                                          | [BioST\@TS tutorial](https://biostats-r.github.io/biostats/github/)         |
|                                | Reproducible workflows for data analysis (targets)       | [GitHub repo](add%20link%20to%20repo), will be updated soon                 |
|                                | Best practise in data analysis                           | [OS Repo](https://github.com/Open-Science-Course/OS-course-teaching-material)                                                                      |
|                                | Best practise for reporting scientific results           | [OS Repo](https://github.com/Open-Science-Course/OS-course-teaching-material)                                                                      |

## Other resources

-   [BES guides](https://www.britishecologicalsociety.org/publications/guides-to/) The British Ecological Society has a series of guides to research excellence on topics like data management, reproducible coding and more.
-   [BioST\@TS](https://biostats-r.github.io/biostats/) BioST\@TS is an online platform with everything you need to know to write your thesis in R.
